author: adiasg
content: Is there a standardized way to get the SSZ state object from the `/eth/v1/debug/beacon/states/{state_id}` (https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/#/Debug/getState) endpoint?

author: paulhauner
content: Yep it’s in the Lighthouse endpoints

content: Search for SSZ in those docs

author: adiasg

author: jgm
content: I think Teku provides this, as well

author: adiasg
content: I imagine this functionality would be super useful for diagnostics. Is this something that is possible to include in the standard API for all clients?

author: ajsutton
content: Yep Teku has `/teku/v1/beacon/states/:state_id` and `/teku/v1/beacon/blocks/:block_id/state`

author: ajsutton
content: It would be useful to add to the standard API at some point.  There's a question of whether it should be a new endpoint or just use the `Accept` header - I like using the `Accept` header but don't think the endpoint to get ssz states should be under `debug`.

author: adiasg
content: I agree that the SSZ endpoint(s) should not be under debug. There are so many production-level things that need SSZ, some of which I have encountered are: SSV middleware and WS server

author: jgm
content: There are two things there.  First, I'm a fan of the idea that an `Accept` header could be used to return SSZ rather than JSON for all relevant endpoints.  Second, moving `state` out of `debug` is definitely something that would be good to do, but not sure if we'll get that sorted for v1 (we already have a bit of a backlog, and it would be nice to hit mainnet with a finalised v1)

author: mpetrunic
content: I think we discussed initially, to have Accept header to determine type of response json, ssz, xml but didn't wanna add ssz in v1 to burden clients even more

author: mpetrunic
content: It's abit harder to add on endpoints which have metadata imo. Since we are missing ssz types for those

author: paulhauner
content: What’s useful about our state SSZ endpoint is that there’s no container or anything, just pipe it to a file and you have a genesis.ssz

author: paulhauner
content: That’s really the only time I’ve needed SSZ personally

author: paulhauner
content: Not opposed to it though

author: mpetrunic
content: yeah, it probably makes sense for block endpoint also?

author: paulhauner
content: I can’t see an immediate use for it, but it does seem useful

author: paulhauner

author: adiasg
content: I think it's super useful for having a composable software stack. Can't imagine the SSZ endpoint (or even the state JSON ones) being useful to normal users by themselves.
